pullRequest.title: Track time lapsed to start analysis server and finish indexing
pullRequest.bodyText:
We want to find the time lapsed to start the analysis server and finish indexing, and send these values to analytics.
Example times:
Has computed errors: 6890
Indexing has finished: 28634

commit.message: Report computed errors time to analytics

nodes.bodyText: We usually great a getService method on classes instead that passes in a Project instance. That is a bit cleaner than calling getService on the project itself.

Is this method ever actually called with (indexingFinished == true)?
If you are trying to catch an internal logic error, change this to
assert(!indexingFinished) to clarify the intent.
make this like the other services in the project that have a getInstance method that takes a project.
nit: avoid starting methods that aren't setters with the word set. Maybe call this: onProjectOpen()

Avoid methods that return boxed numbers. Add an assert that projectOpenTime != null and return a long.
Perhaps return 0 if the project hasn't been opened.
add a separate isProjectOpen instead of using a null Long to indicate unopened.
if you have to convert the long to an int, return it as an int instead.
